Detailed Description

Class ServiceThread is used to implement services, i.e. tasks which perform permanent background activity like network services. A service thread does not need any graphical user interface but needs to run as an own thread. It only always awakes from idle when it receives a message or when a timer expires. To handle the message overwrite method OnMessage(). For an automated start-up and shut-down of the service thread use class ServiceThreadStarter.

Usage of ServiceThreads

1. Derive your class from ServiceThread and overwrite the following protected methods: 

    virtual void OnPowerUp();                   // add the initialization code here
    virtual void OnPowerDown();                 // add the finalization code here
    virtual BOOLEAN OnMessage(const Message& msg);      // handle the messages here

For handling the messages it is also possible to write an own UserDispatcher instead of overwriting OnMessage and add it to the service thread by calling GetContext().AddDispatcher(&my_disp).

2. For automated startup and shutdown of the service thread use class ServiceThreadStarter and add the following code to any module which will not be removed by the linker: 

    static ServiceThreadStarter g_my_service_starter(MyServiceThread::GetInstance());

void ServiceThread::Stop (  INT  exit_code = 0  ) 
 

Stops the service thread by sending the ServiceThreadTerminateMsg to itself. After receiving this message ServiceThread::OnPowerDown is called and the thread terminates.
